subtitle: last of the five good Emperors was a
student of stoic philosophy he was
greatly influenced by the writings of
Seneca and Epictetus as evident from his
personal Reflections during campaigning
and administration
he didn't get angry he didn't allow his
emotions to guide his judgments and he
didn't despise his enemy he acted firmly
and justly postured that calmed an
already nervous Empire in times of
extreme tensions
stoicism provided Marcus Aurelius with a
guideline to use when facing this dress
of life and as the leader of the most
powerful Empire in history you know that
his stressors were plenty
this guideline was compiled into
meditations Marcus aurelius's personal
Diaries the private thoughts of the
world's most powerful man giving advice
on how to be wise on our decisions just
in our judgments Brave in our actions
temperate in all of our doings to
practice self-control discipline and
modesty
